fu.util

Class LuceneUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • fu.util.LuceneUtil

  • public class LuceneUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for the Lucene textsearch environment.

    • Method Detail

      • getTokens

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getTokens(Analyzer analyzer,
                                                              java.lang.String input)
                                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Tokenize an input string as done by an Analyzer object. This is usually not necessary if you use a QueryParse. But for programmatically create queries, an Analyzer is not explicitly involved. This call can be used to create the corresponding tokens (i.e. list of the single words).
        Parameters:
        analyzer - the Analyzer object
        input - the text input
        Returns:
        the tokens
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if underlying files are not accessible

      • createBooleanQuery

        public static Query createBooleanQuery(Query q1,
                                       Query q2,
                                       BooleanClause.Occur occur)
        Create a BooleanQuery from two sub queries. If one of the sub queries is be null, the other query is returned. If both sub queries are null, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        q1 - first sub query
        q2 - second sub query
        occur - nearer definition of the "or ", e.g. MUST, MUST_NOT, SHOULD
        Returns:
        the BooleanQuery

      • createBooleanQuery

                                       Query q3,
                                       BooleanClause.Occur occur)

        Parameters:

        q2 - second sub query
        q3 - third sub query
        occur - nearer definition of the "or ", e.g. MUST, MUST_NOT, SHOULD
        Returns:
        the BooleanQuery

      • createAndQuery

        public static Query createAndQuery(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tokens,
                                   java.lang.String field)
        From a list of tokens create a query that checks each token using OR operator.
        Parameters:
        tokens - list of tokens
        field - field
        Returns:
        Query

      • createFuzzyOrQuery

        public static Query createFuzzyOrQuery(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tokens,
                                       java.lang.String field,
                                       int maxEdits)
        From a list of tokens create a query that checks each token using OR operator. Each token is fuzzily checked as indicated by maxEdits.
        Parameters:
        tokens - list of tokens
        field - field
        maxEdits - indicator of the fuzziness
        Returns:
        Query

      • createPrefixOrQuery

        public static Query createPrefixOrQuery(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> prefixTokens,
                                        java.lang.String field,
                                        int minLength)
        From a list of tokens create a query that checks each token using OR operator. Each token is prefix-checked against the list of prefixes. Only prefixes that have a minLength are considered. Note, this method may return a null object if no single prefixToken has minLength.
        Parameters:
        prefixTokens - list of tokens
        field - field
        minLength - minimal prefix length
        Returns:
        Query

      • getQueryTerms

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Term> getQueryTerms(Query query)
        Given a query - what are the Terms in this query.
        Parameters:
        query - a query
        Returns:
        list of terms

      • matchTerms

        public static java.util.BitSet matchTerms(Query query,
                                          java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tokens,
                                          IndexSearcher searcher,
                                          int docId)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        For a query, a specific doc and the list of tokens of the query string: compute the set of those tokens that matched the query. The result is a BitSet object where get(i)==true when the token(i) of the input string matched the query.
        Parameters:
        query - a querys
        tokens - list of tokens
        searcher - the IndexSearcher object
        docId - the document ID
        Returns:
        a BitSet
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if underlying files are not accessible

      • getHitTokens

        public static void getHitTokens(Query query,
                                IndexSearcher searcher,
                                int docId,
                                java.util.AbstractCollection<java.lang.String> hitTokens,
                                java.util.AbstractCollection<java.lang.String> nonHitTokens)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        For a query and a specific doc - which tokens of the query string matched and which not. The caller has pass empty collections hitTokens and nonHitTokens.
        Parameters:
        query - a query
        searcher - the IndexSearcher object
        docId - the document ID
        hitTokens - object to store the list of hit tokens
        nonHitTokens - object to store the list of non-hit tokens
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if underlying files are not accessible

      • getHitTerms

        public static void getHitTerms(Query query,
                               IndexSearcher searcher,
                               int docId,
                               java.util.AbstractCollection<Term> hitTerms,
                               java.util.AbstractCollection<Term> nonHitTerms)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        For a query and a specific doc - which terms of the query matched and which not. The caller has pass empty collections hitTerms and nonHitTerms.
        Parameters:
        query - a query
        searcher - the IndexSearcher object
        docId - the document ID
        hitTerms - object to store the list of hit terms
        nonHitTerms - object to store the list of non-hit terms
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if underlying files are not accessible
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the query class is not recognized
